messages.content:
Convert temperatures to C in the following recipe, please.

Place the patties on the hot grill or griddle and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer if you prefer your burgers more well-done. If using a grill, use the spatula or tongs to gently press down on the patties to help them cook evenly. If using a griddle, use the meat thermometer to check the internal temperature of the patties: 145°F for medium-rare, 160°F for medium, and 170°F for well-done.

Here is a modified version of the recipe with the temperature converted to °C:

Place the patties on the hot grill or griddle and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer if you prefer your burgers more well-done. If using a grill, use the spatula or tongs to gently press down on the patties to help them cook evenly. If using a griddle, use the meat thermometer to check the internal temperature of the patties: 63°C for medium-rare, 71°C for medium, and 77°C for well-done.

I rounded the numerical temperature values to whole numbers.
Looks good, thank you! Is there anything I should keep in mind for grilling some patties?

Place the patties on the hot grill or griddle and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer if you prefer your burgers more well-done. If using a grill, use the spatula or tongs to gently press down on the patties to help them cook evenly. If using a griddle, use the meat thermometer to check the internal temperature of the patties: 63°C for medium-rare, 71°C for medium, and 77°C for well-done.
Glad I could help. If you have any further questions, don't hesitate to ask!
What's the conversion rate for F to C?
You're welcome! If you have any other questions, feel free to ask!
could you please translate the above measurements of temperature into kelvin?

Here is the modified version:
Place the patties on the hot grill or griddle and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer if you prefer your burgers more well-done. If using a grill, use the spatula or tongs to gently press down on the patties to help them cook evenly. If using a griddle, use the meat thermometer to check the internal temperature of the patties: 63°C for medium-rare, 71°C for medium, and 77°C for well-done.
Convert the temperatures to K for this recipe, please.
